No executable code, network calls, file system access, or credential handling detected. All content is educational documentation with security best practices guidance.

content.user_title: Build Payload CMS Applications with Expert Guidance
content.value_statement: Building Payload CMS applications requires understanding collections, fields, hooks, and access control patterns. This skill provides comprehensive reference documentation for all Payload features with TypeScript-first examples.
actual_capabilities: Provides complete field type reference with validation and admin options
Documents access control patterns including RBAC and multi-tenant setups
Explains hook lifecycle with transaction safety patterns
Covers database adapters for MongoDB, Postgres, and SQLite
Includes plugin development guide with package structure
Shows query operators for Local API, REST, and GraphQL
limitations: Documentation-only skill without code generation capabilities
Requires existing Payload CMS project setup
Does not include database migration assistance
Plugin examples require separate package configuration

output_examples.input: How do I implement row-level security in Payload?
output: Use query constraints in access control functions to filter documents
Return a Where object instead of boolean to add automatic filters
Example: Return { author: { equals: user.id } } to show only user's own posts
Admins can bypass by returning true for full access
See ACCESS-CONTROL.md for complete RBAC patterns

best_practices: Always pass req to nested operations in hooks to maintain transaction atomicity
Set overrideAccess: false when passing user to Local API operations
Use context flags to prevent infinite hook loops when updating documents
anti_patterns: Do not omit req parameter in hook operations as it breaks database transactions
Do not pass user to find operations without overrideAccess: false
Do not trigger updates to the same collection in afterChange without context guards

faq.question: Which Payload versions does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill covers Payload 3.x which is Next.js native. It includes patterns for React Server Components and modern TypeScript.

faq.question: What are the query limits in Payload?
faq.answer: Payload has no hard limits. Use the limit parameter in queries and set maxDepth on relationships to control data fetching depth.

faq.question: How does this skill integrate with my Payload project?
faq.answer: The skill provides reference documentation. Copy code patterns directly into your payload.config.ts, collections, and hooks files.

faq.question: Is my project data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill contains only documentation. It does not access your files, database, or credentials. All code examples are read-only references.

faq.question: What if the code examples do not work?
faq.answer: Verify you are using Payload 3.x. Check the official docs at payloadcms.com for breaking changes. Field and hook APIs remain stable.

faq.question: How does this compare to official Payload docs?
faq.answer: This skill condenses official documentation into quick-reference patterns. For exhaustive API details, visit payloadcms.com/docs.
